FuncDef: The arp gratuitous-arp send disable command disables an interface from sending gratuitous ARP packets. The undo arp gratuitous-arp send disable command restores the default configuration. By default, the function of periodically sending gratuitous ARP packets on an interface is not enabled or disabled. Instead, the global configuration policy is used.

ExtraInfo: If a device has a lot of interfaces that are Up and have IP addresses configured, enabling the device to send gratuitous ARP packets will consume excessive CPU resources, affecting services. To resolve this problem, run the arp gratuitous-arp send disable command on a specified interface to disable the interface from sending gratuitous ARP packets.
